On Wednesday 08 June 2005 10:23, Martijn Dashorst wrote:
> Sometimes it is necessary to use the sourceforge staff to do a rename of
> directories instead of a refactoring.
>
> We had lots of problems when we moved our package structure from
> com.xxx.yyy to wicket.zzz because CVS was still checking the whole
> com.xxx.yyy source tree. When we had sf.net staff remove the com.xxx.yyy
> directory structure in CVS we saw our synchronization times drop a few
> minutes.
>
>  Refactor your package structure often enough and you are really screwed
> when synchronizing with sf.net.

Thanks, Martijn; I'll bear that in mind.

-- 
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
It's called *extreme* programming, not *stupid* programming.
